Dialogs.Dialog: Rinko
You look serious. What's wrong？
I went to a cat cafe the other day. There was one girl who didn't like me.
A cat cafe？ Heh. Well, cats are fickle.
But this girl, the moment I saw her, she freaked out. I thought, "I can get along with this girl！".
Hmm, why don't you try catching them with bait then？
Bait...？
Yeah. Like a can of mackerel.
Hah...
Haha, that's right. I can't give them canned mackerel for humans, can I？
They are cats！ They won't get along with you if you think you can catch them with bait or something shallow like that. You don't understand.
...I'm sorry.
Huh？ A scratch on your hand？
Rinko
Oh, I got this one at the cat cafe.
You've been there again.
I have to go through until I can make that girl change her mind.
So that's how you got clawed by the love of your life. That's tough.
It's just a little, it's not a big deal. And I've disinfected it.
You look kind of happy in spite of being scratched.
(I didn't expect you to be so mellow, ▲小早川＊▲.)
Rinko
Hey. Listen to this. She finally fell asleep right next to Rinko！！
She？
Yes, showing her belly and tossing and turning next to Rinko.
Ah, the cat cafe. Maybe it's time they let you touch them, then？
No！ Girls are sensitive. If you touch them out of the blue, they won't like it.
That's how it works？
That's right.
I see... Girls are sensitive, so don't touch them, huh？
...what？
No, nothing？
Hmm. Lecher old geezer.
(...she realized it.)
What's the matter, you look kind of lonely？
Rinko
I went to the cat cafe, and she was gone.
Why？ Sickness？
No. I heard that she recently had an arranged marriage and they're having a baby.
Then we must congratulate her for her marriage.
Sure. But I won't see her for a while because of the birth... I'll miss her.
They said she's coming back with a cute kitten.
...yeah, that's right. And that girl found her significant other, so she's happy.
Yeah, just like us, ▲小早川＊▲！
Haha...
That's a lot of words. Yes, I'd be relieved if she was as happy as Rinko is right now.
Rinko
I mentioned Volvavin, didn't I？
The one that your little brother is into.
Yes.
Are they still playing Volvavin with you？
Not that. My little brother found a plastic model of Volvavin at a toy store.
Heh. Plastic model, huh.
So we decided to make it together.
Can you make plastic models ▲小早川＊▲？
...I'm an onee-chan and I'll do my best for my precious little brother.
I see. I don't know if this will help you, but I'm here to listen.
Yeah.
Rinko
Plastic models are surprisingly difficult.
I don't think it's that hard to make if you follow the instructions.
That's what makes it so difficult. There are too many parts.
Oh... Volvavin's a complete transformable combined reproduction！ I think they were advertising it.
I guess it was suddenly too difficult...
That may be true.
Hah... I wonder if I can make someone do it for me.
I can help you if you like.
...hmm, no good. In times like these I have to show how good I'm as an onee-chan.
(You want to make it yourself...)
Rinko
...let me tell you one thing.
Hmm, what is it？
It's about Volvavin's plastic model.
Oh, I knew you wanted me to help.
Nobody said that.
So, what's the deal？
I found a Gaston X plastic model in a toy store the other day.
Gaston...？ Oh, I remember it was Volvavin's rival robot.
When you display them, don't you think it would be cooler to have them together？
...I think you should finish the Volvavin first, then you can think about it.
Yeah... but I already bought it.
(Then I don't think we need to discuss it...)
Speaking of which, what happened to the plastic model of Volvavin？
Rinko
It didn't work, huh...
You shouldn't underestimate Rinko too much, okay？
Ah, then...
Of course it's finished. Hehe.
Good for you, congrats. Your little brother must be happy.
I guess. I wish I could show you the bravery of Volvavin.
And the Gaston X one？
Naturally. Now they are fighting on our bookshelf.
I see. I though you were more clumsy, ▲小早川＊▲.
...clumsy？
Ah...
Volkickーーーー！！
Rinko
Hey, I'd like to talk to you about something.
What is it？
What is a good visit gift？
A visit？ For someone sick？
Not for that. You know, Hanamaki-sensei the English sensei, she took maternity leave, right？
Ah, that was it.
So, the class decided to send something to pray for the birth of a healthy baby.
The birth of a baby, huh. I've never had a baby before...
...it's obvious... I lost my time asking you.
I was joking. That kind of thing is better decided by the girls in the class than by asking the guys, right？
Maybe, then I'll do that.
Rinko
Last time we were talking about Hanamaki-sensei.
Yeah, about celebrating the birth of a baby.
The class decided to send flowers. It seems overly safe, though.
The students are giving it to her, so I'm sure she'll be happy with whatever they give her.
I hope so.
...hey, what are you grinning at？
You discussed this with you class, didn't you？ I just thought that if things had stayed the same in the past, you would have thought it was a hassle, ▲小早川＊▲.
I still don't really like that kind of thing.
Still, it's growth, right？ That's a good thing.
Hah... meddling old man.
Rinko
The plan about sending Hanamaki-sensei flowers isn't going well.
Is that right？ Isn't the only thing left to do is to decide what kind of flowers to send？
Yes, but that's why they're arguing.
What kind of flowers do you want to send her, ▲小早川＊▲？
Hmm... I saw a potted tulip plant at the flower shop in front of the station the other day and I liked it.
I thought potted plants were not good gifts.
Ah... the "falling asleep" thing. I wonder if it's not good even if it's something to celebrate.
Um... maybe mochi？
That's too sweet.
My bad.
Don't worry, a mochi is an alternative. I'll talk to the florist.
That's the correct answer.
Rinko
You know. I went to visit Hanamaki-sensei with some of my classmates.
Oh, she was born, then.
Yeah. They also showed me the newborn baby.
How did it go？
She squeezed Rinko's fingers with her very tiny hands. Ah, geez, she's too cute！
Wow, do you want a baby when you see something like that？
Ouch... why！
Sexual harassment.
(Why！)
What kind of magazines do you usually read, ▲小早川＊▲？
Rinko
Why.
I have a strong image of you always reading thick books.
I read magazines, too. But I'm not really interested in what's trendy these days...
Trendy, huh... that's because you're not old enough, ▲小早川＊▲.
It's not about age, don't you get it？
What do you mean？
I'm talking about the inside. There's no way an old man like you can handle kids these days, you know？
(But I'm supposed to be into trends too...)
Rinko
We talked about magazines the other day. What kind of magazines do you read？
...manga magazines are the most common. Like Dash Weekly or something like that.
Hmmm... a magazine full of girls in swimsuits...
...eh？ I said it's manga.
I don't know which is the real purpose.
As I said, it's just manga.
Well, I don't care either way. Good grief.
(That's an accusation...)
Hmm, what's with the bad mood？
Rinko
The fashion magazine I was going to buy was sold out.
What！？
Why are you surprised？ You mean you're surprised that Rinko reads fashion magazines？
You said the other day that you don't read those.
I didn't say I wouldn't read it. Rinko is very flexible there.
...that so？ So what was it about the magazine that you were after？
...featured collection.
Of what？
Fashion.
(That's probably true...)
Rinko
You seem strangely happy. Did something happen？
This is the featured fashion magazine you tried to buy before, ▲小早川＊▲.
Huh？
Isn't that what they call "beloved fashion for boyfriends"？
Wha-why！ That's wrong！
Really？ A girl in my class was reading it, so I thought that's what it was.
No, of course not. Don't get all excited on your own.
My bad. I thought it would be nice if you thought like that, ▲小早川＊▲.
...hmm, I see.
Hmm？
Nothing！
Rinko
Boys really are too childish.
Why don't you ask me "what happened？".
You seem grumpy, so I thought maybe I shouldn't ask...
This is the place to ask.
Yes, yes. What happened？
Nevermind. The boys in my class are getting excited about a ghost in the library.
Ghosts？ I've never heard of that.
Rinko doesn't know, and she's not interested. And yet, they come and tell me every single time.
They come to tell you, ▲小早川＊▲？
Because I'm a member of the Library Committee. There is no such thing as exterminating ghosts in the job of a librarian.
(...that's right.)
Rinko
I told a senpai member of the Library Committee about the ghost.
Why not just leave it alone？ It's a boring rumor anyway.
That's what my senpai said.
Right？
But they talk about it all the time in class.
Is the gossip still going on？
Not only is it going on, it's spreading. Even though Rinko is not interested.
Not interested？ Doesn't mean you're not a fan of it？
What？ Nobody said that.
Huh... there. There's something behind you, ▲小早川＊▲...
Ah！？ D-don't say weird things！
(Don't be that surprised...)
Rinko
Hah... I've had enough of this. About the ghost story.
It hasn't gone away yet. It should be over by now.
Ostensibly. But the boys seem to be planning a courage test.
A test of courage means at night, right？
Boys are really childish, you know. There's no such thing as ghosts.
You don't have to be there. Planning these things is the fun part.
Even you say such things.
Because isn't it exciting to go to school at night？
Rinko doesn't understand.
I mean, what if it really comes out？
There was some kind of commotion in the school, right？
Rinko
You know, the boys said they were going to test their mettle. I heard they broke into the school in the middle of the night and set off the alarm.
Ah-ha.
Their parents were called in, and they were very angry. They got what they deserved.
So, in the end, was there a ghost？
It turns out to be an ill- fitting door in the storeroom. As Rinko said, there is no such thing as ghosts...
Huh！？
Oh, sorry. I dropped my phone.
D-don't scare me！
...are you still afraid？
I'm not scared, I'm just surprised. You idiot.
(You don't have to get so worked up about it...)
Rinko
Hey, do you like interior design？
I don't know if I like it. But those who are into it are quite enthusiastic.
My mom likes it a lot. So, it looks like there is a new interior design store, even though it is a little far away.
Oh, I remember the last time it was featured on TV.
She wants to go see that place once.
With that look on your face, you don't want to go？
Not that I'm saying that. Rinko doesn't plan to change the interior of her room, so I thought it would be boring.
Go there, you might be surprised how much fun you'll have.
I hope so.
Rinko
The interior design store we talked about, I think I'm going to end up going there.
I see. Well, if you're going to go all the way, go have fun.
Yeah, but mom said that we should redecorate Rinko's room while we're at it.
You don't want that, ▲小早川＊▲？
Yes, simple is best.
...that's easy to understand.
Rinko likes it now, but she says it should be more cutesy...
Cutesy, huh...
...what's so funny？
Nothing. I think cute would be fine.
...as if it were someone else's business. But when I see mom enjoying herself, it's hard to tell her I don't like it.
Did you go to that interior design store we were talking about the other day？
Rinko
Not yet. My family will be going with my dad for his vacation.
I wonder if your room will be more cute then, ▲小早川＊▲.
...what？ Why are you looking forward to it？
Sort of.
Don't grin. I don't think it will be as cute as you expect it to be.
Is that so？ Since you are going through all this, why don't you try？
Rinko has a non-negotiable line. You can't go beyond that.
(I can't wait to see what the room will look like.)
Rinko
I went to the interior design store.
Oh, I see. How was it？
It was more fun than I had imagined. I was able to try various combinations on the computer.
Wow, I didn't know there was such a thing.
It's like a puzzle, and you can enjoy all kinds of combinations.
Sounds interesting... So what about redecorating？
It went perfectly.
Oh, the cute type！
Not that. I managed to stop it perfectly. I even convinced my mom.
What...
You don't have to be so disappointed. If you want me to, I'll think about it in the future.
(In the future...？)
Rinko
It's a bit of a problem when hobbyists are in my house. I'd rather it be in moderation.
Who are you talking about？
Dad. He's always had many hobbies, but now it seems he's a camera guy.
It's gonna be a lot of work to do it for real...
It sounds like he's doing it within his pocket money. It's just...
What's up？
As for his daughter, it's hard for her to be forced to model.
You could at least do the modeling for him.
But when he says "I like that pose！" or "That expression is so cute！" it's embarrassing. Even when we're outside.
(That might indeed be embarrassing...)
Is your dad still going on with his camera？
Rinko
Hah, I guess...
Are you still the model, ▲小早川＊▲？
The whole family, in case you're wondering. I feel like Rinko is the most affected.
Don't call it damage. Maybe he wants to document his daughter's growth.
People don't grow up in 10 minutes.
Haha, yeah. Well, you're not lacking as a model, ▲小早川＊▲.
...don't say embarrassing things in the middle of the street.
(No good, huh... I thought I could say it.)
Rinko
Don't you think it's a little embarrassing now to take a family group photo？
Hmm？ Ah, you're talking about your dad's camera.
After the attack on Rinko subsided, he asked for a group photo of the family.
I think it's nice. You don't like it？
Feel free to tell me. If you just want to take a picture, that's fine...
Hmm？
I think he's up to something. He says that regular family photos aren't interesting enough.
What kind of unusual photos are you talking about...？
I don't know about it, but my dad seems up to something...
What happened to the family photo？ You told me your dad was going to take it.
Rinko
Oh, that.
So, I take it was going to be an interesting photo.
...yeah. He even suggested renting a studio.
Studio, huh? That's really so authentic. You should enjoy it too, ▲小早川＊▲.
Why doesn't he just take a normal family photo？ It's something that will last forever.
...I see. A weird photo might be hard to look at after many years.
Really？ That's why my mother and I tried so hard to stop him. There was no way we were going to take a family photo in costumes.
(I would have liked to have seen that... what a shame.)
Rinko
My little brother often brings his friends over to our house. Kids are so cute.
I guess, innocent and energetic.
Of course, my little brother is the cutest of them all.
Haha, acting like a tough onee-chan.
I don't care what they say. Cute things are cute.
Come to think of it, do siblings fight？
I don't think so. They are still children, you know.
(I think you also have a childish side, too, ▲小早川＊▲...)
Is that a bruise on your hand, ▲小早川＊▲？
Rinko
Oh... I might have hit it a bit playing squadron with my little brother's friends.
You even go along with that kind of thing.
Yes. Boys have so much power.
...that sounds like a lot of work to deal with.
Even if you call it "playing," you have to be serious with them. Otherwise, it's impossible.
Mothers raising children are hard workers, aren't they？ You must feel drained every day.
You want me to play with you too...？
Rinko
Lately, I'm having trouble raising children.
Parenting！？
My brother.
What... that's a weird was of saying that.
You are overreacting.
And, is that a rebellious phase？ Sometimes he does not listen to Rinko, and it's hard.
If you have a child in the future, you'll have a much harder time, ▲小早川＊▲.
You think？ I guess so, it's so hard with my little brother... I can't even imagine my own kids.
...your children, ▲小早川＊▲？
Don't imagine things on your own.
It's fine, I was curious.
Just don't imagine it！
Rinko
Kids are moody. When you think they are rebellious, they start to spoil you.
Ah, your little brother's friends？ But it's the same with you, ▲小早川＊▲.
Are you trying to say that Rinko is childish？
I wouldn't go that far, but... you'd suddenly get angry or acting spoiled.
I don't act like that.
You think？
Yeah. It's a matter of how you feel, isn't it？
I wonder about it...
You are persistent... Oh, what. Do you want me to spoil you？
I didn't mean it like that... but being spoiled sounds nice.
Hmm, as I thought. Then, I will spoil you in moderation, discretion, and in accordance with TPO.
Haha, yes, yes.
Rinko
I have a book I want, but I can't seem to find it.
Have you tried contacting the bookstore？
They said it's out of print.
That would make it hard to obtain. Do your best to find a used book... or at an auction.
Hmm, I wonder if Rinko's allowance is enough.
By the way, what book is it？
...that's fine. Because you'll laugh at me.
(A book that will make me laugh...？)
Rinko
I knew that old books don't seem to be stocked by publishers.
Oh, the book you're looking for？ Then why don't you look in the used bookstore district？
Used bookstore district, huh...
I hear you can find some crazy bargains sometimes.
...I see. I'll check it out. Thanks.
When my girlfriend is in trouble, it's a man's job to help her！ How's that？
I'm glad I have a boyfriend I can count on, really.
(Hmm？ You're being too honest...)
Rinko
I went to the bookstore district the other day.
Did you find the book you were looking for？
No... I was just very impressed with Ojii-chan from the store, who searched for me so diligently...
Heh, sounds nice.
Yeah. They even asked someone I know at the store, which was really nice of them.
But even going after all that you couldn't find it, it's going to be difficult.
They said they'd call me if they found it... I think I might have felt a bit guilty about that.
Why？ You want it, don't you？
I'd like to thank everyone for getting me this far. And of course, thanks to my boyfriend for being so dependable.
(I wonder what the book was about...)
Rinko
You know, I found the book.
What book...？
The book I was looking for. The store called me, and that Ojii-chan found it for me！
I see！ You did it.
Yeah. I'm really glad that Rinko's allowance will be enough to buy it.
I see. I'm glad it wasn't something expensive. So, what kind of book is it after all？
Hmm...
Well, I'm not going to forcing you.
Nah, it's good... Um, this is the first book Rinko bought.
I see！
...I suddenly remembered it and wanted to read it again. I looked all over the house for it, but it wasn't there.
A book of memories, huh？ A good book is different and interesting when you're an adult.
You're not laughing？
I wouldn't laugh.
I see... I'll let you read it someday... It's really embarrassing now.
Rinko
Lately, it seems that many girls are being picked up in front of train stations. They seem to be quite persistent.
Are you okay, ▲小早川＊▲？
Yeah, Rinko is fine. Don't you worry about me.
Well, yeah. I was wondering if you'd kick those men...
...hey, which one are you worried about？
Both！
...well, okay. By the way, have you ever picked up a girl？
Eh？ I've never had to...
...it looks like you're not lying.
(Nothing to be jealous about...)
Rinko
I went by the station and saw a guy who was really picking up girls.
Ah, those rumors.
Yeah, apparently it's just one guy. He's always picking up girls.
Didn't you get tangled up in it？
Well, I was just watching from afar. And if I get tangled up, you'll come to my rescue, right？
Well, that's true.
But？
You know, there might be a delay in getting help.
Is that even possible？
Eh？ Um... there isn't！
Hehe, that's Rinko's boyfriend for you！
(I said it without thought...)
Rinko
That pick-up guy in front of the station, he is causing a commotion.
The sensei told the girls to watch out. You be careful too, ▲小早川＊▲？
If he calls on Rinko or anything...
Yikes！ Don't do that. It's dangerous, okay？
I know. You really are a worrier.
But, you know, I wonder if he thinks women will like him if he is so persistent.
I guess he doesn't know the saying, "If you can't push it, try pulling it."？
Hmm, sounds like a very familiar opinion, doesn't it？
Eh？ ...I was talking in general.
In general... well, it's fine.
(I was sweating all this time...)
Rinko
I was picked up in front of the station the other day.
Eh, that pick-up guy. Are you all right？
Yes. He said "Did you drop this handkerchief？".
...handkerchief？
It was an ojii-chan.
That's not the pick-up guy in your example...
Yeah, but when I talked to him... he said his grandson came down with a cold and he was looking for who dropped it instead.
...grandson？
Ojii-chan's grandson is the pick-up guy in the example.
Ah！ If he was looking for who dropped it, why didn't he reported it to the police station？
I heard that he fell in love with her at first sight when he saw her drop her handkerchief. He only knew that she was a student at our high school.
(So that's the real story behind this...？)
Rinko
I looked at your book loan list, and I think you should read a few more books.
...you think？
It's not even close to Rinko's.
That's because you're comparing it to yours, ▲小早川＊▲.
There's only so many books you can read in a lifetime. You have to make good use of your time.
Good use, huh...
In the meantime, would you like Rinko to pick out a book for you？
What do you recommend, ▲小早川＊▲？
"Assigned reading for middle school students".
...oh, you've grown up a little since the old days！
Good for you.
(...I wonder why I'm happy about this.)
You recommended this book, ▲小早川＊▲...
Rinko
How did you like Rinko's assigned reading？
I haven't read it yet... they were all thick books, you'd think they were dictionaries.
I picked a book that you could use your time on in a meaningful way.
I'd like to be able to read it more easily. I can't carry it with me.
You're being selfish, then I'll make it a little more light, casual, and beginner-friendly.
...I'll leave it to you.
Well, we should gradually get used to it.
...hmm？
Nothing. I mean, just keep your expectations high.
(I hope it'll be okay...)
Rinko
How's the lite version of Rinko's assignment book？
I can read it, so...
American literature isn't bad.
...not bad, maybe.
I'm wondering if you really know what you're talking about... though I'm really wondering if you really understand it.
I can't tell you how in detail, but I just said, "I like it".
Well, that's okay.
And, it's still interesting to read while thinking about you, ▲小早川＊▲.
Hah？ What's with that.
I wonder what you like about the book, or if you laughed or felt sad when you read it, ▲小早川＊▲.
What's with that... that is... Ah, geez, I shouldn't have taught you that.
(Maybe you think I can watch your thoughts...)
It's about the book you recommended me, ▲小早川＊▲.
Rinko
...I don't want to speak about that.
I see...
...don't make that face. What？
I've tried to understand it properly since then, but it was still too difficult for me.
I see.
Sorry.
You don't really have to apologize. I didn't want to force you to do anything.
I may have said it before. We don't need to have the same interests.
Just the fact that you tried to understand Rinko makes Rinko happy.
Rinko
Hehe.
You seem to be in a good mood, huh？
They're doing a location test for the new Fight with Fear at the arcade in front of the station.
Fight... what？
Fight with Fear, a fighting game. It's been a long time since the last one, okay？
I see... what's a location test？
To be placed on a trial basis, in some stores, before its release. No amateurs here！
I'm an amateur...
Ah, I can't wait to play！ It's been a long time since I've had this much gaming fever.
(It's true that it's not often that you get like this for anything, ▲小早川＊▲...)
Rinko
I went to the FWF location. There was quite a line, though.
FWF？
You know, the new fighting game.
Ah, Fight with...
Fear.
Yeah. So how did it go？
I lost each time...
It's your first game. It's not that easy to win, is it？
The conditions are the same for the other party.
I see... I heard that your opponent was a developer who came in secretly.
Oh, that could be it. I was feeling a bit coy about it... I won't let him beat me this time！
(If you targeted him, he won't get away with it, ▲小早川＊▲...)
Rinko
...I can't get my intuition back at all.
Hmm, what are you talking about？
I was supposed to be good at the FWF series, but...
Oh. What's this about gaming？
It's not what it's about. Losing a game against someone makes me feel like I'm being denied.
That's such an exaggeration.
K.O. I'm overlapping myself with the character that was done to me... I need to look at myself again.
Just take it easy and enjoy it, it's a game.
I wonder if the frames for invincibility are being adjusted, geez...
(She's not listening to me...)
How did it go the fighting game？
Rinko
The location test is over now.
Oh, I see.
Besides, I was already at my limit.
At your limit？
Financial reasons.
I see. But you'll play it when it's officially up and running, right？
That's right. I've got some sense of what I'm doing, and until then, I'll keep working on the previous home version of the game.
Is it really that good？
What, are you interested？
Ah...
I can't help it, I'll give you a little lecture. Let's start from the beginning...
(Oh, crap...)
Rinko
You know, which do you prefer, email, phone or in person？
...I think it's best to meet and talk in person.
That's right. But there are things that are hard to say in person, right？
Yes, I guess the right answer is to use them in different ways.
Phone calls and e-mails？
What a businessman-like reason.
You think...？
Well, what about letters？
Letters？ That's still a ceremonial thing...
You still look like a businessman... are you really a high school student？
(I'm your senpai...)
Rinko
We talked the other day about the use of phone calls, e-mails, or letters. What about seriousness？
What do you mean by seriousness...？
In the order that you can't say it face to face, I guess. You wouldn't say it over the phone, but you would say it in an e-mail or a letter, wouldn't you？
...like hot weather？
It doesn't have to be out of focus. It's about two people who are dating.
Then... "I like you" or "I love you" or something like that？
...well, yes...
Hmm？
I think we've said that quite a bit... maybe.
Um... maybe？
I understand that it doesn't apply to you. That's not a bad thing, though.
(...so that's just me？)
Rinko
I asked a friend. About phone calls, emails and letters.
Excuse me？
She said that she rarely makes phone calls.
What about letters？
She's never written anything before.
That's usually the case.
If I received a letter from you out of the blue, I would probably get all defensive and wonder what's going on.
You'd imagine it's serious stuff.
Just imagining it makes me a little nervous. In a not-so-good way.
I see.
Rinko
Ah, yeah, I found a good use for letters.
Other than telling serious things？
Yeah. A message from Rinko now to you in the future.
Huh？
If it's a letter, you can leave it there forever without reading it.
Unless you can't hold back and open the letter.
That sounds pretty hard to do.
Yeah... Rinko doesn't think she hold back.
Haha, it might be hard for me too.
I thought it was a great idea...
Rinko
Hah... why are parents so noisy？
What's up？
They told me on the way out to clean up my room properly.
Well... that can't be helped.
But I was going to clean it up later. And yet...
...I also made the same excuse.
Rinko's not making an excuse. She's really going to do it.
Hah～ah, bad timing. Thanks to you, I don't feel like cleaning up anymore.
Aren't you trying to make that a reason not to clean up？
Eh？ ...No, not at all.
(...you really are.)
Did you clean up your room？ Remember you told me the other day？
Rinko
...you remembered, you have a good memory. Speaking of memory, you know...
Haha, don't fool yourself. You're not going to clean up？
Actually... not yet. Just a little bit, I just let my books out.
Just a little？
Just a little. I am sure that if it were a man, it would be at a level that would be forgivable, unfair.
That's uncalled for... Your parents will yell at you, you know？
I guess.
...Hah, I guess I still have to do it.
Rinko
Rooms, you know, just when you think you've cleaned them up, they get messy again.
Again？
In the process of cleaning up, I found some old books and CDs that I've missed... and I'm appreciating them.
...a weird development.
It can't be helped. Once you get curious, it's hard to stop.
But if you do that, it's like you'll never finish cleaning up the mess.
...it's okay... probably. I'll do my best to break the temptation this time.
How？
How, you ask... By giving my best.
(You can't just do your best...)
Rinko
I finally finished cleaning up my room. Now I won't have any complaints, will I？
Such bragging. I thought it was just a matter of not making a mess.
Don't sound like my mom.
Yes, yes.
So, what about your room？
Um...
Hmm？
Well, it's like that... right？
Since you've said so many great things to Rinko, I wish you'd show me a code of conduct.
Yes...
Hehe, it feels good to have a clean room.
Rinko
The other day, I went to hear a lecture on behalf of the Library Committee.
Oh, about the library operation？
Yes, I was escorted by the sensei. I was so sleepy.
...did you doze off？
I managed to hold my ground. But why do the stories of great men have such a hypnotic effect？
Haha, indeed.
The homeroom sensei, then the head of the grade, then the vice principal, then the principal, they all make me sleepy, it's strange.
So what stories have you heard while fighting sleep？
...all I remember is fighting sleep and winning.
More importantly, after the lecture, I got to tour the stacks at the city library, the closed stack type. I could spend a day in that one and not get tired of it...
(You're not good at learning in a classroom, ▲小早川＊▲.)
Rinko
...Hah, this is love.
Eh！？
What, you surprised me.
I'm the one who got surprised. What do you mean with "love"？
Oh, I was talking about the stacks at the city library that I was shown before.
...don't say something so confusing.
Heh, maybe that was jealousy？
It's not like that.
But, you know, I doubt you are jealous of books.
I told you not to make fun of older people.
You always get angry when I treat you like an old man. Hehe, you got upset.
(It's kinda frustrating...)
Rinko
I need a new bookshelf. I have more books and I'm having trouble finding a place to put them.
You're right, books take up a lot of space.
Compare the bookshelves in Rinko's room with the stacks in the municipal library I saw the other day...
How can you compare them...
I can't help but think it would be nice to have a storeroom like that.
If there were such a thing in the house, you would be locked up in there, ▲小早川＊▲.
...huh？ Would you miss me？
...that's not what I'm saying.
Don't worry, I'll come out to see you once in a while.
(Once in a while！)
Rinko
I have a book I want, but I'm refraining from it.
I though you bookshelves were full already, ▲小早川＊▲.
Yes. I feel like I'm at my limit.
Can't you get rid of a few？
There's no way you can do it.
Why？
There is no way I would throw away a book. I have a lot of feelings for them, and I can never do it.
Then sell it or give them to friends. Or donate them, you know？
Donate, huh...
Hmm, but...
(I don't think this will work...)
Rinko
I've been studying painting lately.
Eh！？
...what？
...nothing.
...well, okay. I drew a picture of a cat for my little brother the other day...
Did you give it to him？
He cried...
He cried, huh...
I am frustrated, ashamed, and sorry...
(Crying scary cat...)
Rinko
...hah. How can I get better at painting？
Oh, I see. Still can't make your little brother happy, can you？
No, they were pleased, but unwilling.
Unwilling？ What did you draw this time？
Chickens. The crest is distinctive, and there's no other way to mistake it. And yet...
They called it a sumo wrestler...
My little brother was happy, but I want him to be happy with the chicken... Hah.
Hey, how about talking to your art sensei？
Art sensei, huh... I see... maybe I should have done that from the beginning. I'll ask around.
(Sumo wrestlers or chicken. I think chickens are nice...)
Rinko
The other day, I asked my art sensei how to become better at drawing.
Heh, what did he say？
He said that if I look at a lot of good paintings and improve my sensitivity, I might get better... Rinko wants to get better right now.
You can't do that right now...
Just, you know, if I don't do this, my onee-chan's image will be completely destroyed.
You said you were overthinking it, but he was happy with the result, wasn't he？
...you just laughed.
I'm not laughing！
You laughed inside, Rinko heard you. Hah...
(Was it that shocking...)
Rinko
Hehe.
Did something good happen？
My little brother drew a portrait of Rinko. He did a really good job of capturing her features.
I bet he has a talent for drawing. He's a genius.
That's a high compliment...
Hehe, I'm just an fool onee-chan.
Oh, and what happened with your drawings ▲小早川＊▲？
If my little brother has that kind of talent, Rinko shouldn't bother drawing for him.
Then, your study on painting...
Done. Rinko will watch his little brother's talent blossom.
(Happy-go-lucky, huh？)
Rinko
Hey, when was your first love？
That was too sudden.
See, my little brother, he introduced me to his girlfriend.
...he's in kindergarten.
Mom told me that there are a lot of precocious kids. She said he was dating a girl he often meets at the neighborhood park.
It's not so much a first love as it is a friend.
But, you know, I hear they are committed to a future together.
Future？
Yes, kids these days are not to be underestimated. Don't let them get the better of you, too.
(Maybe I've already lost...)
Rinko
When I got home, my little brother's girlfriend was there, and I had no idea how to treat her.
She's still a kid, so you don't have to be so conscious of it.
They're two people who have pledged their future to each other... What would you do if they were kissing right in front of you？
Eh！？ No way.
But, you know, didn't you ever give a girl you liked a kiss as a prank or something？
So... did you do that, ▲小早川＊▲？
It was Rinko who asked the question.
But, still...
No way, jealousy？ Even though they are small... it shows what they are capable of.
I didn't do it, of course I didn't do it. Don't put that face！
(You're playing with me.)
(I keep wondering how was your first love, ▲小早川＊▲...)
Rinko
Hmm？ ...what are you glancing at.
...oh, I was wondering what happened to you little brother's first love, ▲小早川＊▲.
Rinko has decided to quietly keep an eye on it. So, I'm done with this talk now.
Oh, I see.
Why do you look so disappointed？
I never heard about how was your first love, ▲小早川＊▲.
Why do you care about such a thing？ Rinko's first love was a musician.
Isn't that unfair？
It's not unfair. Well, beyond musicians... you...
What！？
Maybe.
(It's not fair！)
About your first love, ▲小早川＊▲――.
Rinko
Geez, you're so persistent. More importantly, what about you？
That would be...
Would be？
Um...
Small kick！
Ouch.
Geez, why don't you just say Rinko already, even if it's a lie？
Sorry, then...
Time is up. This episode is really over！
(...well, you don't seem to be really mad at me.)
Rinko
When I was on the train before, I was thinking "I wish I could go as far as this".
I think about that before tests...
That's just escaping reality. What Rinko is trying to say is that she wants to go far away.
I don't think it would make much difference.
It's totally different. I wish you could understand me more.
Want to forget everything？
Yes, something like that. At the end of an endless line of tracks, maybe...
Gazing out the car window, I think about such things.
Isn't that strange, ▲小早川＊▲？
Yeah？
(...it definitely is.)
Rinko
Hey, are you happy now？ Are you thinking of going somewhere far away？
I think I'm happy... Oh, you talked about that before. "I want to go far away" or something.
That's it. But you know, that happiness depends on your relationship with Rinko.
Well... indeed.
I've been thinking lately. I wonder if this happiness will last... forever.
Hmm？
Oh, don't get me wrong. It's not that I don't like you or anything.
...I hope so.
Well, Rinko thinks about it a lot sometimes. Don't worry about it.
(What was that...？)
Rinko
Hey, what if Rinko disappears and your current happiness is destroyed？
...it's still weird. What happened before this, what happened to happiness？
Um... nothing much.
Nothing much... you're not hiding anything from me, are you？
I'm sorry. You don't have to take it so seriously.
You already told me that...
I told you before. I just wondered if happiness is forever...
Yeah.
Our relationship is eternal.
That's what I'd like it to be.
Hehe, then it's all fine.
(Hmm, something's still not clear.)
Rinko
...I finally finished it.
Huh？
I was reading a serial novel called "Days of Love and Farewell," also known as "Aiwaka".
Novel？
The protagonist, who was leading a happy life, is betrayed by his family and friends, and his happy everyday life falls apart. He thought it was forever, but everything is gone...
I think I heard that somewhere...
I was reading Aiwaka, and I just got influenced by it.
I couldn't say it out loud because I felt like I was getting caught up in a fad, but when I finished it, it felt better.
You know... sometimes you say funny things, so I thought something was wrong.
Hehe, I guess that's the best way to live an ordinary day.
(With you it really doesn't feel like that, ▲小早川＊▲.)
Rinko
I've been watching Animal Channel a lot lately.
Do you watch animal shows 24 hours a day？
Yes. At first, I didn't know what's so interesting, but they were doing a cat special.
Is that cats all over the place from start to finish？
Yes, cats everywhere.
That why you can spend hours on it...
It's only two hours per broadcast.
Only！？
I can't get enough of it. Playing directly is great, but cats on the screen have a different quality.
(You're pretty hooked...)
Rinko
I wonder if they will do another cat special on the Animal Channel. I'm having withdrawal symptoms.
Hmm, you can't keep cats in your house, ▲小早川＊▲？
Really？
I just wanted to know...
Because, you know, I might forget about you if I care for the cats too much, you know？
...it's going to end in choosing between me and a cat.
Right？ Well, the answer is obvious.
That's right！
It must be the cat.
I'm kidding. Come on, we made a promise,
Rinko
Hah... I'm really worried.
Did something happen？
For Rinko, it is a matter of life and death.
What？
There's a DVD coming out featuring cats. Includes unaired extras.
Ah, from the show before.
And yet, Rinko's financial situation is in a lot of trouble. What should I do？
You don't have to worry about that...
That's a... limited sale, remember？ You can't get it again, okay？
Hmm... Well, is it an important issue？
It is！ I guess I'll have to hold off on the potato chips for a while until the release date.
(Is that enough...？)
Rinko
I ended up pre-ordering it. A DVD featuring cats.
Is your allowance okay？
In exchange for helping out around the house, my dad is going to give me a gift. Hehe.
Good for you... but you're not very good at housework, are you, ▲小早川＊▲？
I'll do whatever it takes for my beloved cats.
...so you want it that much.
Well, the appeal of that show is hard to understand for those who haven't seen it.
Your words make it sound like a great inspirational piece of work, ▲小早川＊▲.
It's a 5 DVD set in total, and the cat is purring the whole time. In a way, it's a very moving film.
(5 DVDs of that...)
Rinko
Sometimes you want to take a road that you don't normally use.
Yeah, I kind of get it. There are some unexpected discoveries, you know.
So, you know, I did it, and I found a retro coffee shop.
Coffee shop？
Yes. Not a cafe, but a coffee shop. It's a coffee shop, with a hint of Showa-era.
Did you try to get in？
No. Old stores like that have a kind of "no regulars allowed" atmosphere, don't they？
Really？
It's like a gangster shopkeeper. If I opened the door, I would be yelled at.
(What kind of storefront is that？)
Rinko
The retro coffee shop run by the gangster owner I told you about the other day.
You didn't check to see if the gangster owner was there, did you？
So I went to make sure.
I see.
I took a quick peek through the window, and it looked like a quiet-looking ojii-san working alone.
That would make it easier to get in, wouldn't it？
Naive. They may look calm on the outside, but I bet if you make a noise in the store, they'll blackmail you！
Oh, come on.
That's how tense the store is.
(You're just imagining things as you go along, aren't you？)
Rinko
I finally went inside the coffee store run by the gangster owner.
I guess it's totally decided to be a gangster owner's store. So, how was it？
Yes, the tea and cake were delicious.
I don't mean that...
The ojii-san who owns the shop？ He was friendly and kind when I talked to him.
Then how about calling it in a different way？
I see. I'll have to think of something to call it.
Just a regular coffee shop.
The music playing in the restaurant has a nice flavor, too. I don't know much about jazz, but it fits the atmosphere.
Rinko
Since then, I've become friends with the ojii-san at the retro coffee shop.
Heh, it's rare that you like something that much, ▲小早川＊▲.
I guess.
If you got to know each other so well, did you have anything in common？
Ojii-san said he used to run a record store.
Heh, so he's a retired coffee shop owner now, huh.
I'm not a jazz specialist, but I can handle some pretty intense music. That's why we got into a good conversation.
Heh, but if it's such a nice place, I'd like to go there too.
Mmm, no.
Why！
It's like no kids allowed. Besides, I like the idea of Rinko's Secret Shop.
(But you're a child too, ▲小早川＊▲...)
You don't see that much dramas, do you, ▲小早川＊▲？
Rinko
I guess. What about you？
I do sometimes... girls in my class are talking about romantic dramas.
When I watch romantic dramas, I feel ashamed of myself.
Is that so？
Besides, you know, when you watch it with your family. You know, there are some scenes that get awkward.
Yeah. Dad would cough and change the channel.
It's hard because we have some curious boys in our house.
They're still tiny, so they don't know what's going on.
Naive, so naive. You shouldn't underestimate today's preschoolers.
Rinko
Near my house, I came across a drama being filmed.
I see, what kind？
It seems to be a school drama, I think？ A lot of popular idols are going to be in it.
If it was a school drama, I could watch it with my family.
That's shallow, I hope it's still an adult romance, but go ahead and have a kissing scene in a school drama.
...I understand.
I can easily imagine my little brother saying to me, "You also get kissed, onee-chan".
(That's tantalizing...)
I wonder what kind of drama they were filming near your house, ▲小早川＊▲.
Rinko
A school love story. The main character is a boy who fell in love with a girl in his junior year.
Eh？ ...I see.
It sounds like something you've heard somewhere, doesn't it？
Who knows？ And will the love be fulfilled properly？
If you're curious, why don't you just watch？
It's not that I'm curious, it's just that, you know, it's my position, you know？
Hehe. Well, you don't look alike, though.
Huh？
I mean the opposite.
Opposite？
You and Rinko's is about a girl who fell in love with a senpai, right？ Originally, you know.
Did you see the drama？ The school romance one.
Rinko
We ended up watching it together as a family.
Well, it was all fine, wasn't it？ And the park nearby was featured.
Yeah. My little brother was in a frenzy.
Then I guess the drama will be enjoyed by the Kobayakawas.
No, we can't... They were filming a kissing scene in that park.
Huh？
Everyone will stop moving.
I see... Then if you're interested, I'll tell you what it's about.
Great. If you want, why don't we reenact it in that park？
What！？
I'm just kidding. Hehe.
Rinko
You see the floor plans of houses posted at real estate agencies.
Yeah, the ones that are slapped on the windows.
Don't you think those are fun to watch？
Really？
If I were to live there, huh...
Yes. Imagine if you lived there from the time you wake up in the morning to the time you go to bed at night.
I woke up, went to school, came home and went to bed...
That's the most despairing thing I've heard in a long time. You're going to lose your life that way.
Ugh...
Rinko
The other day my family and I went to a housing exhibition.
You finally went to see the real thing, not just a floor plan.
Well, that's about it. My parents seem to like it rather a lot, too.
Is it really that fun？
There are a lot of parents and children. That's why there are so many things designed to keep them occupied for the whole day.
For example？
There were food stalls where they and Rinko went.
It's a total festival.
Buying a house is a major life event. In a way, it feels like a festival.
...really？
Hmm, in the future I'll be thinking about a house to live in myself. It's something to look forward to.
(Well, it sounds like fun.)
Rinko
Do you ever want to move out？
Why... oh, maybe it's because you went to a housing show？
I wanted to make a quick change in my environment, including where I live.
That said, it would be difficult in practice.
So now I'm only holding out within my fantasy.
Besides, if you move far away, for example, I won't be able to see you easily, will I？
I don't want that... oh, but sometimes long distance relationships can be surprisingly dramatic.
H-hey...
Kidding... hehe.
(Don't scare me～！)
Rinko
...I cried a little after that.
What's going on！？ What do you mean after that？
Don't panic. We talked about long-distance relationships.
Oh, you're talking about moving.
I was in bed thinking about if I had to be in a long- distance relationship with you, and I started to cry.
I guess I can look at the floor plan and imagine it for a while. For another 10 years or so.
Why 10 years？
I thought it would be a good idea to save it until I actually need it.
I see, so we can have fun again then, right？
Hmm？
Don't talk about it like it's someone else's business.
Eh？
Rinko
You know, what do you think of amusement parks？
What do you mean...？
I'm not sure.
That's not clear enough. What's wrong？
That's, you know, the "Kobayakawa Theory". Do you want to hear it？
Kobayakawa theory？ Sounds interesting, tell me about it.

The relationship between life and amusement parks. When we're young, with our parents; when we are young, with our lovers; when we are old, with our children; and when we are old, with our grandchildren. You see, amusement parks are with life.
(I think I understand, but I also kinda don't.)
Rinko
Remember the "Kobayakawa Theory"？
Amusement parks are for life.
Yes. I have an application of the theory, do you want to hear it？
Please, Prof. Kobayakawa.
A wise decision. If you know this, you're sure to make a lot of money.
Money？ Isn't that a life argument？
I guess it's an economic theory. In other words, if you attract children and women, adult men will follow. As long as you don't miss that point, you are sure to have a prosperous business.
It's kind of getting fishy all of a sudden.
That's what economics is all about. The point is, if you want to make money, get women and children.
(Don't be so gullible...)
Rinko
You know that story about the man and woman who eat grilled meat together having a deep relationship？
Who knows... is that the "Kobayakawa Theory" too？
Nope. I heard it from a friend. I heard it's a pretty common story.
Heh, I see.
Maybe if you and Rinko ate grilled meat every day, they could have a deeper relationship with each other.
You'll get tired of it.
Then fine, steak or teppanyaki. But hamburgers and the like seem to be a no-no.
(Anything with grilled meat...)
Rinko
Want to hear the new Kobayakawa Theory？
Haha, please. Professor Kobayakawa.
How about a man and a woman eating offal together, and being very close？
Then... is this about the couple eating grilled meat from before？
Yes, offal seem deeper than yakiniku, don't they？
I kinda get it... but I kinda don't.
Because they are offal！？
Even though it's not that nice... fine. Did you verify the theory？
That was a good idea, but Rinko can't tolerate offal.
(That would be bad for you.)
Rinko
I guess, girls should have cute stuff.
I don't think they should, why？
It's been a trend around here to decorate phones and such. Well, it's been going on for a while, but especially recently.
Heh, you don't try it, ▲小早川＊▲？
I don't.
The why you said "should"？
Everyone says Rinko's belongings are plain. As a boyfriend, what do you think？
Well, I don't think they're flashy. It's fine. You can have what you think is good, ▲小早川＊▲.
Well, you know, that's my basic stance...
(So you're confused.)
Rinko
I went to a shopping mall with a friend the other day.
Heh, what did you see？
Yeah, actually... Rinko's phone is plain, so she told me she's going to deco it for me.
Oh, I thought you didn't want to do that.
That's my basic stance. I'm flexible on it, you know？ For the time being, I'm just observing.
If it's no big deal, why don't you just try it？
As I said before, I'm just observing.
Yes, yes. So how was your visit？
...was pretty interesting.
Haha, I see. Good for you.
So, I guess your phone won't be deco'd after all.
Rinko
...I actually tried it once.
I see. So does that mean you undid it？
Yes, it's fine to look at it once in a while, but I don't feel comfortable with the stuff I use on a daily basis being so elaborate.
I knew that simple was the way to go for Rinko.
Haha, I knew it. That's a good thing to know.
Maybe. Besides...
Hmm？
A phone with all the bells and whistles is like a cat in clothes; it's a bit stuffy.
I see, very typical of you, ▲小早川＊▲.
I like cats in clothes because they are cute, but that means you shouldn't go too far.
Ah, that reminds me.
Rinko
What？
Talking about decorating your phone, were your friends okay with it？ I know they recommended it.
Yeah, they were just trying to help me out.
I see.
It wasn't for me, but I learned a few things.
Learned？ What？
When Rinko chose a phone, she chose a simple one. She said that everyone chooses a phone based on the assumption that it will be decorated, in other words, the material.
Heh, I see.
I thought it was a bit suggestive, whether to choose something you like from the beginning or change it to your liking later.
...that it is？
Rinko chose you because she liked the original you. That's how it is.
Rinko
Do you remember what your favorite book was when you were little？
Hmmm, I remember the scenes and pictures, but I think the story is a bit vague.
That happens. I happened to see such a book in a bookstore the other day, so I read it.
Heh, how was it？
I knew it was different from what I remembered, but it was very interesting because I felt like I was betrayed in a good way.
What's the story？
It's about a girl who gets lost on her way to visit a friend's house.
Mm-hmm.
Rinko remembers that the girl went after the cat and managed to get home...
And it wasn't？
Yeah, not at all. She called home and had them come pick her up.
(What's with that...)
Rinko
We were talking about a book I read when I was little.
Oh, you mean the one where your memory was totally different？
Yeah, that one, I think I got the title wrong.
I see. Well, that's a different story.
Yeah, I found out that Rinko's memory is not so good.
Isn't everyone like that？
Maybe. Perhaps there are other things like that.
Yeah, there could be quite a lot of them...
You're an old man, right？
Just a year older.
I'm sure I'll remember these standard exchanges when I grow up, though.
(That's nice...)
Rinko
They say humans are forgetful animals. You know, like the story I told you about the book I read a long time ago.
Ah, about misremembering.
Yes. I don't want to be too forgetful, but I also don't want to remember things persistently.
Once you learn something, you don't forget it, though, which is useful for tests and such.
You are just a child. You always say "test" right away.
Why do you want to forget things that much, ▲小早川＊▲？
Not so much what Rinko wants to forget, but also what I want you to forget.
Huh, me？ What？
That's because you've seen a lot... You've seen a lot of embarrassing things.
I might have a pretty good idea what it is. Hmm...
Hey, don't get any funny ideas！
Rinko
If one of us forgets what we experienced together, it's okay.
Are we talking about memory？ Well, I will remember you, ▲小早川＊▲.
That's my line. They say old people are forgetful.
I'm just one year older, though. When I really start to forget things, you'll be an obaa-chan, ▲小早川＊▲.
That's no good. We'll both forget.
Well... can't be helped.
Why？ Rinko doesn't want that.
Sorry, I'm just saying weird stuff.
No problem.
At any rate, I think I would be happy if we could stay together until the time when I start to forget things.
Yeah, me too.
Rinko
I hear cats meowing all night long from near my house.
A stray cat, maybe.
I think. The cry was so loud.
It's especially resonant on quiet nights. It sounds sad and lonely.
You don't think someone is picking on them？
I don't know. I couldn't find it when I looked for it.
That worries me.
Yes. If it had been hurt, I would have at least taken care of them.
Rinko
It's about the stray cat that's meowing near my house...
Did you find it？
I decided to look for them in the middle of the night when they were crying, since I couldn't look for them in the daytime.
It's not safe at night.
It's okay. I just need to look around the house.
Even so...
Perhaps you're worried about me？
It's obvious.
Hehe. I guess I shouldn't worry my boyfriend. But I'm curious...
Rinko
You know... I'm sorry.
What's that？
I was still worried about the meowing cat, so I went out in the middle of the night to look for her.
...honestly.
But it's okay. I had my dad keep me company.
I see, then it's fine. So did you find the cat？
Yeah, I couldn't bring her home, but from the looks of it, she wasn't hurt either.
Well, good for them. I wonder why they've been meowing all night though.
I asked my dad about it, and he said she was probably just in heat.
Ah, so that was it.
It sounded lonely to Rinko...
Rinko
I think Hana-chan has a boyfriend.
Hana-chan？ A friend of yours, ▲小早川＊▲？
The cat that meowed at night. And it's hard to call her without a name.
Haha, I guess she was in heat after all, having a boyfriend.
Don't laugh, it's the natural order of things.
You said she sounded lonely ▲小早川＊▲.
Shut up. You're Rinko's boyfriend, if you can't be honestly happy for the cat's happiness, you're an unqualified boyfriend.
Sorry, sorry. I hope you'll be happy, Hana-chan.
I hope Hana-chan's boyfriend is a delicacy cat. Unlike you.
(That was uncalled for...)
Rinko
Say, what do you think is the difference between a day trip and an outing？
Day trip？ Hmm...
If you're coming back that day, it's just like going out in general.
Hmm, maybe difference in distance...
How long before it becomes a day trip？
I don't know. Why do you care about that？
Once that definition is clear, every date you and Rinko have could be upgraded to a day trip, you know？
(Upgraded... sounds nice.)
Rinko
The difference between a day trip and a regular date, I get it.
Oh, besides the distance issue？
Yes, it's a matter of distance, but it's not quite the same.
Hmm？
What about the issue of distance between us？
Heh, you're good.
Right？ If you go away for a little while and both of you think it's a trip, it's a trip.
That's right. Then we can always take a day trip from now on.
Hehe, that's how it is.
Rinko
I told my friends about the day trip and they were in a groove.
The concept of it being a trip, wherever a couple wants to go？
They were surprised at Rinko's idea.
I see. Good for you.
Yes, so I'm going on an upcoming day trip with these friends.
Haha, I see. Then, why don't you call me？
It's not like that. It's a women-only trip.
How was that day trip with friends？
Rinko
It was fun. We just watched a movie, had tea, and went to karaoke.
That's great.
But, you know, we naturally talk about boyfriends.
Oh... I see. Not used to that kind of thing.
Don't worry, I didn't say anything strange.
Haha, I see. You must be so proud of your boyfriend！
Huh, didn't get it right？
I'll tell all my friends about what you just said.
No, please！
Rinko
I was doing a street interview for a TV project.
Wow, what's it like？
"Do you want to spend 24 hours a day with your lover？", like that.
24 hours, huh... How would you respond, ▲小早川＊▲？
To be honest, it may be a subtle...
...I see.
Because it's 24 hours. No matter how much you like them.
But if we got married, we'd be together twenty-four hours a day, wouldn't we？
Hah！？ Marriage！？
Yeah, in general... Oh, no. I didn't mean to imply that we were getting married or anything like that！
...you're an idiot.
Rinko
I heard that many people were watching the interview "Do you want to be with your girlfriend for 24 hours a day？".
You seem to be dissatisfied with something.
A surprisingly large number of girls wanted to be with him for 24 hours.
Is there something wrong with Rinko's senses...？
I don't think it's going to go so far as to be weird.
Because, you know, Rinko loves her boyfriend too, right？ But there are times when you want to spend time alone！！
Wait a moment, ▲小早川＊▲.
What？
You're too loud. People are looking at you...
Ah...
(I guess they thought it sounded like a lover's quarrel... not that I mind, though.)
What are you thinking？
Rinko
...why.
You're silent.
I was just thinking. I told you before that Rinko wants to spend some time alone.
Yes.
That's true, but when I'm alone, I want to hear your voice.
"I want to see you", like that.
Yeah, I know what you mean.
The more I think about it, the more I wonder if Rinko is thinking the same way as everyone else after all.
And you don't like that？
...I'm not saying that.
Rinko
"Would you like to be with your lover for 24 hours?".
Oh... you were thinking about it again.
It's a really interesting subject. In general.
(I feel like you were just blurting out your own thoughts...)
What.
Nothing. And the result of your thinking？
After all, Rinko doesn't want to be with you.
Hmm. To be continued？
What do you mean？
From the way we talked before, I'm not sure that's the end of the story... though I'm hoping it is.
...only say it once. How many hours we've been together, or how we'll never leave each other...
I want to be like that, like I don't care about such things, like it's natural to have you next to me. Maybe that's how I feel... The end.
You read a lot of novels, ▲小早川＊▲？
Rinko
Yes. I like non-fiction a lot, too.
Aren't there still a lot of manga around？
That's right, Rinko likes manga too. Just the ones that everyone else seems to be reading...
Hmm？
Like this, a dull girl suddenly falls in love with a perfectly good-looking guy.
That kind of opportunism is a bit much. I understand that it's all right as long as it's fun, and it's not wrong as entertainment.
That's harsh.
And the reality is...
...I'm sorry, I'm not a handsome guy
It's not bad. I don't like perfect people. Good for you.
(...well, I should be glad.)
Rinko
Do you know a shoujo manga called "Kokoro Match"？
I guess I had at least heard the name...
I'm getting a lot of requests to put it in the library. I don't know what they are thinking.
Maybe we've talked about that before, but we can't have manga？
Some people say... that depending on the content, you know, it's important not to set a precedent.
In case you're wondering, I only borrowed the first volume from a senpai. The setting is a girl with an unrequited crush with a handsome twin brother...
So, in your terms, ▲小早川＊▲...
I feel embarrassment. But I know how to read it.
How to read？
Yes. You should read these books with an empty head and a pure heart. If you do that, you will enjoy it a lot.
(I feel like I'm making a compromise, but I actually feel like I'm being very oblique...)
Rinko
I'm starting to feel like I can put "Kokoro Match" in the library.
What, it was that good？
...Yeah. I'm ashamed of myself for not reading it and making fun of it.
So you really like it, ▲小早川＊▲.
Yeah, first of all, the pure love of the main character, Haruka, comes swooning.
By itself, it's just a shoujo manga, but the way the romantic partner's feelings change, and the way the sub-characters are intertwined... is very good.
It's not like what you said before about reading with an empty head.
Yes, that's it. It's so interesting even if you just skim the surface, and it's deep when you get right down to it. I guess that's why it is popular with everyone.
Heh, if it's that good, why can't you put it in the library？
Hmm, I'm still thinking about it...
I see you've decided to include "Kokoro Match".
Rinko
On a trial basis. However, this time the clause is an exception.
If we put in a request for everything, there would be no end to it.
I see. Case closed for the time being.
Right.
Oh, I want to have a love life like "Kokoro Match"...
Eh！？
That's fine. It's enough to yearn for manga romance.
Yes, but I think... you're not happy with your current relationship.
Not like that, but humans are greedy and they want it all.
Maybe so...
Fiction only, of course. In the non-fiction category, you are the unquestionable number one in the ranking.
